item.title: [TUT] Forms, Forms, Forms(Intermediate) [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

[size=30pt]Creating forms and applying them to scripts.[/size]

[size=15pt]Chapter 3 coming soon![/size]

This course will teach you about forms. The difficulty varies from beginner to intermediate to advanced.

This is a continuation of Chapter 1 in forms.
Chapter 1 - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,7621.0.html
Chapter 2 - Here
Chapter 3 - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,10472.0.html

[u]Chapter
Chapter 1 : Lets create a form (Beginner)
Chapter 2 : Combo boxes and Saving settings (Intermediate)
Chapter 3 : Adding colour and images (Advanced)

[u]What is a Form?
A form is basically an easy way to set-up your scripts. It provides a user-friendly interface where you can type in all your information.

[u][size=20pt]Chapter 2 : Combo boxes and Saving settings (Intermediate)
Requirements
You must have read chapter 1.

Overview
In Chapter 2, I will show you how to add checkboxes and how to save settings to your scripts for next time they run the script. We will be using the form from Chapter 1 although we might make it a bit bigger.

[u]Setting up
First we need to open the form editor then open the form you created in Chapter 1. Once open, make the size of it bigger and move the "Start" button down

Eg.

[u]Creating the Combo box
Now we are going to create a Combo box. Click on the combo box icon then click an empty place on the script. You may now change the “Text”.

Eg.

Once that has been done, we must now add options

Click on the ""¦" and you should get another box. In this tutorial, I am going to add True and False.

Eg.

Now click "OK" and then save your form.

[u]Implementing the form into your script
Open the script you had from chapter one.
Once again, load the form (Tools -> Load DFM Form) and you should get a bunch of lines.

Replace the variables and the procedure “InitForm” with your new scar.

Once again we have to change:

  frmDesign.Visible := True;

to

  frmDesign.Visible := False;

And also:

Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign); Button1.Parent := frmDesign; Button1.Left := 79; Button1.Top := 161; Button1.Width := 75; Button1.Height := 25; Button1.Caption := 'Start!'; Button1.TabOrder := 10;
To

Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign); Button1.Parent := frmDesign; Button1.OnClick := @ButtonClick; Button1.Left := 79; Button1.Top := 161; Button1.Width := 75; Button1.Height := 25; Button1.Caption := 'Start!'; Button1.TabOrder := 10;

Now go to the procedure “ButtonClick” and remove the WriteLn line.
Now go to the “SetupAll” procedure and add

case ComboBox1.Text of 'True' : PlayerActive := True; 'False' : PlayerActive := True; end;

That will change the String : “True” to a Boolean. Obviously we need to declare PlayerActive as a Boolean so do so now.

Your scar should look somewhat like this:

[code]program FormBegginerTutorial;
var
frmDesign : TForm;
Label1 : TLabel;
Label2 : TLabel;
Edit1 : TEdit;
Edit2 : TEdit;
Button1 : TButton;
ComboBox1 : TComboBox;
Username, Password : String;
PlayerActive : Boolean;

procedure ButtonClick(sender: TObject);
begin
//WriteLn(‘You have clicked the button’);
frmDesign.Caption:= frmDesign.Caption + ‘.’;
frmDesign.ModalResult:= mrOk;
end;

procedure InitForm;
begin
frmDesign := CreateForm;
frmDesign.Left := 250;
frmDesign.Top := 114;
frmDesign.Width := 263;
frmDesign.Height := 235;
frmDesign.Caption := ‘User and Pass Saver’;
frmDesign.Color := clBtnFace;
frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText;
frmDesign.Font.Height := -11;
frmDesign.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
frmDesign.Font.Style := [];
frmDesign.Visible := False;
frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96;
Label1 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
Label1.Parent := frmDesign;
Label1.Left := 32;
Label1.Top := 40;
Label1.Width := 51;
Label1.Height := 13;
Label1.Caption := ‘Username:’;
Label2 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
Label2.Parent := frmDesign;
Label2.Left := 33;
Label2.Top := 65;
Label2.Width := 49;
Label2.Height := 13;
Label2.Caption := ‘Password:’;
Edit1 := TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
Edit1.Parent := frmDesign;
Edit1.Left := 93;
Edit1.Top := 35;
Edit1.Width := 121;
Edit1.Height := 21;
Edit1.TabOrder := 8;
Edit2 := TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
Edit2.Parent := frmDesign;
Edit2.Left := 93;
Edit2.Top := 62;
Edit2.Width := 121;
Edit2.Height := 21;
Edit2.TabOrder := 9;
Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
Button1.Parent := frmDesign;
Button1.OnClick := @ButtonClick;
Button1.Left := 79;
Button1.Top := 161;
Button1.Width := 75;
Button1.Height := 25;
Button1.Caption := ‘Start!’;
Button1.TabOrder := 10;
ComboBox1 := TComboBox.Create(frmDesign);
ComboBox1.Parent := frmDesign;
ComboBox1.Left := 58;
ComboBox1.Top := 105;
ComboBox1.Width := 145;
ComboBox1.Height := 21;
ComboBox1.ItemHeight := 13;
ComboBox1.TabOrder := 11;
ComboBox1.Text := ‘Active?’;
ComboBox1.Items.Add(‘True’);
ComboBox1.Items.Add(‘False’);
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;

procedure SetupAll;
begin
Username := Edit1.Text;
Password := Edit2.Text;
case ComboBox1.Text of
‘True’ : PlayerActive := True;
‘False’ : PlayerActive := True;
end;
end;

begin
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
SetupAll;
WriteLn('Username = ’ + Username)
WriteLn('Password = ’ + Password);
FreeForm(frmDesign);
end.[/code]

In the main begin, lets add another Line.

  WriteLn('Active = ' + Combobox1.Text);

This will tell us if its true or false. That"s about it for combo boxes. Lets move on to saving settings.

[u]Saving the settings of a Form
Alright, now to saving settings. Firstly, go to the procedure SetupAll. Now lets look at the SaveSetting procedure.

procedure SaveSetting(section, setting, value: String);

Let me explain.
Section = Section!(eg. “UserPassSaver”);
Setting = What part you want to save(eg. “Username”)
Value = What is the string?(Eg. Edit1.Text)

Now in the SetupAll procedure lets add some lines.

SaveSetting('UserPassSaver', 'Username', Edit1.Text); SaveSetting('UserPassSaver', 'Password', Edit2.Text); SaveSetting('UserPassSaver', 'Active', ComboBox1.Text);

So your SetupAll procedure should look like this:

procedure SetupAll; begin Username := Edit1.Text; Password := Edit2.Text; case ComboBox1.Text of 'True' : PlayerActive := True; 'False' : PlayerActive := True; end; SaveSetting('UserPassSaver', 'Username', Edit1.Text); SaveSetting('UserPassSaver', 'Password', Edit2.Text); SaveSetting('UserPassSaver', 'Active', ComboBox1.Text); end;

[u]Loading the settings
Now that we"ve saved the settings, we must load it.
In your script add a line to the following procedures : Edit1, Edit2 and CheckBox1.

*****.Text := LoadSetting('UserPassSaver', *******).

*****.Text is Edit1.text, Edit2.text etc.
The other ***** is ‘Username’, ‘Password’, ‘Active’ etc.

Your final script should turn out something like this:

[code]program FormBegginerTutorial;
var
frmDesign : TForm;
Label1 : TLabel;
Label2 : TLabel;
Edit1 : TEdit;
Edit2 : TEdit;
Button1 : TButton;
ComboBox1 : TComboBox;
Username, Password : String;
PlayerActive : Boolean;

procedure ButtonClick(sender: TObject);
begin
//WriteLn(‘You have clicked the button’);
frmDesign.Caption:= frmDesign.Caption + ‘.’;
frmDesign.ModalResult:= mrOk;
end;

procedure InitForm;
begin
frmDesign := CreateForm;
frmDesign.Left := 250;
frmDesign.Top := 114;
frmDesign.Width := 263;
frmDesign.Height := 235;
frmDesign.Caption := ‘User and Pass Saver’;
frmDesign.Color := clBtnFace;
frmDesign.Font.Color := clWindowText;
frmDesign.Font.Height := -11;
frmDesign.Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
frmDesign.Font.Style := [];
frmDesign.Visible := False;
frmDesign.PixelsPerInch := 96;
Label1 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
Label1.Parent := frmDesign;
Label1.Left := 32;
Label1.Top := 40;
Label1.Width := 51;
Label1.Height := 13;
Label1.Caption := ‘Username:’;
Label2 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
Label2.Parent := frmDesign;
Label2.Left := 33;
Label2.Top := 65;
Label2.Width := 49;
Label2.Height := 13;
Label2.Caption := ‘Password:’;
Edit1 := TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
Edit1.Parent := frmDesign;
Edit1.Left := 93;
Edit1.Top := 35;
Edit1.Width := 121;
Edit1.Height := 21;
Edit1.TabOrder := 8;
Edit1.Text := LoadSetting(‘UserPassSaver’, ‘Username’);
Edit2 := TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
Edit2.Parent := frmDesign;
Edit2.Left := 93;
Edit2.Top := 62;
Edit2.Width := 121;
Edit2.Height := 21;
Edit2.TabOrder := 9;
Edit2.Text := LoadSetting(‘UserPassSaver’, ‘Password’);
Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
Button1.Parent := frmDesign;
Button1.OnClick := @ButtonClick;
Button1.Left := 79;
Button1.Top := 161;
Button1.Width := 75;
Button1.Height := 25;
Button1.Caption := ‘Start!’;
Button1.TabOrder := 10;
ComboBox1 := TComboBox.Create(frmDesign);
ComboBox1.Parent := frmDesign;
ComboBox1.Left := 58;
ComboBox1.Top := 105;
ComboBox1.Width := 145;
ComboBox1.Height := 21;
ComboBox1.ItemHeight := 13;
ComboBox1.TabOrder := 11;
ComboBox1.Text := LoadSetting(‘UserPassSaver’, ‘Active’);
ComboBox1.Items.Add(‘True’);
ComboBox1.Items.Add(‘False’);
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var
v: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;

procedure SetupAll;
begin
Username := Edit1.Text;
Password := Edit2.Text;
case ComboBox1.Text of
‘True’ : PlayerActive := True;
‘False’ : PlayerActive := True;
end;
SaveSetting(‘UserPassSaver’, ‘Username’, Edit1.Text);
SaveSetting(‘UserPassSaver’, ‘Password’, Edit2.Text);
SaveSetting(‘UserPassSaver’, ‘Active’, ComboBox1.Text);
end;

begin
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
SetupAll;
WriteLn('Username = ’ + Username);
WriteLn('Password = ’ + Password);
WriteLn('Active = ’ + Combobox1.Text);
FreeForm(frmDesign);
end.[/code]

Congratulations, you have just finished chapter 2!
